        Parameters:

        caid - the ID of the CA in question
        Returns:
        true if the token was authorized.

      • flushCACache

        void flushCACache()

      • getCA

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA getCA​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                      int caid)
                               throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a shared CA object from a cache. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to edit. Use this when you need to use the CA, since it's faster. User getCAForEdit if you want to edit the CA object and does not want your changes to be overwritten by another thread.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - identifies the CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode())
        Returns:
        the CA object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        getCAForEdit(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCA

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA getCA​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                      String name)
                               throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a shared CA object from a cache. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to edit. Use this when you need to use the CA, since it's faster. User getCAForEdit if you want to edit the CA object and does not want your changes to be overwritten by another thread.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        name - name of the CA that we are searching for
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        getCAForEdit(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCAForEdit

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA getCAForEdit​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                             int caid)
                                      throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a new CA object from the database. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to simply use. Use this when you need to edit the CA object, since it's slower. User getCA if you want to simply use the CA object and does not need to make edits.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - identifies the CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode())
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        getCA(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCAForEdit

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA getCAForEdit​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                             String name)
                                      throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a new CA object from the database. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to simply use. Use this when you need to edit the CA object, since it's slower. User getCA if you want to simply use the CA object and does not need to make edits.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        name - name of the CA that we are searching for
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        getCA(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • editCA

        void editCA​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
            org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA ca,
            boolean auditlog)
     throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
            org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Changes a CA in the database. Can change mostly everything except caid, caname and subject DN. When editing a CA the CA token will usually be taken off line. So you need to activate the CA token after editing, if auto-activation of the CA token is not enabled.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        ca - the CA to edit
        auditlog - if audit logging of the edit should be done or not, not needed if called from other internal methods that already does audit logging.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - If CA not found
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • verifyExistenceOfCA

        void verifyExistenceOfCA​(int caid)
                  throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException
        Verify that a CA exists.
        Parameters:
        caid - is the id of the CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN))
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA is not found

      • getCAIdToNameMap

        HashMap<Integer,​String> getCAIdToNameMap()
        Returns a HashMap containing mappings of caid (Integer) to CA name (String) of all CAs in the system.
        Returns:
        HashMap with Integer->String mappings

      • getActiveCAIdToNameMap

        Map<Integer,​String> getActiveCAIdToNameMap​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken authenticationToken)
        Returns a HashMap containing mappings of caid (Integer) to CA name (String) of all active and uninitialized CAs in the system that the admin is authorized to.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        Returns:
        HashMap with Integer->String mappings

      • getCAInfoInternal

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo getCAInfoInternal​(int caid,
                                                      String name,
                                                      boolean fromCache)
        Internal (local only) method for getting CAInfo, to avoid access control logging for internal operations. Tries to find the CA even if the CAId is wrong due to CA certificate DN not being the same as CA DN. Note! No authorization checks performed in this internal method
        Parameters:
        caid - numerical id of CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode()) that we search for, or -1 if a name is to be used instead
        name - human readable name of CA, used instead of caid if caid == -1, can be null if caid != -1
        fromCache - if we should use the CA cache or return a new, decoupled, instance from the database, to be used when you need a completely distinct object, for edit, and not a shared cached instance.
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • getCAInfoInternal

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo getCAInfoInternal​(int caid)
        Internal (local only) method for getting CAInfo, to avoid access control logging for internal operations. Note! No authorization checks performed in this internal method
        Parameters:
        caid - numerical id of CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode()) that we search for
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • getCANoLog

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA getCANoLog​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                           int caid)
                                    throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Internal (local only) method to get the CA object without logging the authorization check. (the auth check is performed though) NOTE: This method will return a shared CA object from a cache. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to edit. Use this when you need to use the CA, since it's faster. User getCAForEdit if you want to edit the CA object and does not want your changes to be overwritten by another thread.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - identifies the CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode())
        Returns:
        the CA object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        getCAForEdit(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • mergeCa

        int mergeCa​(org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA ca)
        Local access CRUD method for persisting the CA object to the database and removes any old object with this CA id from the cache.
        Parameters:
        ca - CA
        Returns:
        the CA Id

      • existsKeyValidatorInCAs

        boolean existsKeyValidatorInCAs​(int keyValidatorId)
                         throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Checks if at least one CA references a key validator.
        Parameters:
        keyValidatorId - Validator
        Returns:
        true if there are no references.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized.
